artist: Charles-Nicolas Cochin  II; After Giovanni Lanfranco
description: seated bearded man in voluminous draperies, including cloak-like drapery tied around his neck; man looks up to PR; PR hand held out
marks:
Inscription and Stamp

on mount, in pencil: [C 8
provenance: L. D. Séguin's coat of arms is on the binding of the album in which this sheet was once bound. Comte N. A. Koucheleff-Bezborodko, Lugt 1629 (1834-1862), St. Petersburg. Count Jan Pieter van Suchtelen (1751–1836), cf. Lugt 2332 [reportedly stamped on first page of album], St. Petersburg. Eugene von Wassermann (until 1921; sale, Galerie Georges Giroux, Brussels, Oct. 24- Nov. 5, 1921, no. 954, as part of album); [Alister Mathews, Bournemouth, England; sold to Moir]. Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (until d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Saint Augustine
